title: Courteney Cox and Isla Fisher just shared a weird clip of them as men
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Courteney Cox and Isla Fisher shared a video of themselves posing as men while pretending to urinate and we have so many questions.

The pals, for some reason, came up with the idea to use a filter to look like men and posted the video where Isla, 43, glared at Courteney, 55, as she peed in a restroom.

Ian Fisher and Callum Cox doesn’t have the same ring to it, does it?

Courteney captioned the video: ‘And we unfortunately meet again…. @islafisher’

Isla, keeping to the same theme, captioned hers: ‘We meet again… @courteneycoxofficial’

Advertisement

Advertisement

In the short sketch, the Friends star is seen peeing while standing up (is there anything she can’t do?) before she hears Isla’s voice going, ‘Oooh, there you are!’

Courteney then exclaims, ‘Damn it’ before quickly zipping up and fleeing the scene.

Courteney kind of looks like a skinny Rob Lowe (Picture: @courteneycoxofficial/Instagram)

Creepy cop? (Picture: @courteneycoxofficial/Instagram)

We hope she washed her hands.

Isla then entered the frame looking like a 1970’s sheriff with her aviators and filter-assisted moustache.

She smirks at Courteney before telling her to be ‘Lovely’.

Don’t worry, we didn’t get the joke and neither did a lot of their celebrity friends.

Actress and comedienne Whitney Cummings commented: ‘I have questions’.

Meanwhile, Burn Notice’s Garret Dillahunt wrote: ‘I feel strange’.

At least Queer Eye’s Tan France understood the joke as he commented: ‘LITERALLY SNORT LAUGHED’.

We still don’t get it.

In a less strange series of events, Courteney recently gave us the Friends nostalgia gift we have all been waiting for.

After spending the show’s 25th anniversary celebrations having a dinner party with Lisa Kudrow (who played Phoebe) as well as Charlie Puth and Judd Apatow, Courteney became the host for two more friends – Jennifer Aniston (Rachel) and Matt LeBlanc (Joey).

Underneath, she wrote: ‘A rare night and I love it.’

Advertisement

Looks like she is the real-life Monica of the group, keeping in touch with all of her former co-stars and throwing parties (that we’re totally jealous we’re not invited to).

Our hearts are full and now we can’t wait for a full reunion.
